an5.228:1.1: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks for a family who takes their meals late in the day.
an5.228:1.3: When guests visit, they are not served on time.
an5.228:1.4: The deities who accept spirit-offerings are not served on time.
an5.228:1.5: Ascetics and brahmins who eat in one part of the day, abstaining from eating at night, and from food at the wrong time are not served on time.
an5.228:1.6: Bondservants, workers, and staff do their duties neglectfully.
an5.228:1.7: A meal eaten during the wrong period is not nutritious.
an5.228:1.8: These are the five drawbacks for a family who takes their meals late in the day.
an5.228:2.1: There are these five benefits for a family who takes their meals at a proper time.
an5.228:2.3: When guests visit, they are served on time.
an5.228:2.4: The deities who accept spirit-offerings are served on time.
an5.228:2.5: Ascetics and brahmins who eat in one part of the day, abstaining from eating at night, and from food at the wrong time are served on time.
an5.228:2.6: Bondservants, workers, and staff do their duties attentively.
an5.228:2.7: A meal eaten during the proper period is nutritious.
an5.228:2.8: These are the five benefits for a family who takes their meals at a proper time.”
